name: Mexico
description: Mexico, a land of vibrant culture, stunning landscapes, and rich history, stretches along the western coast of North America. From the arid deserts of the north to the lush rainforests of the south, Mexico offers an incredible diversity of ecosystems and experiences.  Its strategic location has shaped its history, blending indigenous traditions with Spanish colonial influences and modern development.  Mexico boasts a complex geography, including the Sierra Madre mountain ranges, the Yucatan Peninsula, and extensive coastlines along the Pacific and Gulf of Mexico.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Mexico is the 13th most populous country in the world.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated along the coasts and in major urban centers like Mexico City, Guadalajara, and Monterrey.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Mexico is the 14th largest country in the world by area.
quickFacts.detail: This vast territory encompasses diverse climates and terrains.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 17 MXN.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language, but numerous indigenous languages are still spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Over 68 indigenous languages are recognized nationally.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Mexico has a significant and growing economy.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is driven by manufacturing, tourism, and agriculture.

climateData.title: Climate Zones of Mexico
climateData.description: Mexico experiences a wide range of climates due to its varied topography and latitude. From tropical rainforests to arid deserts, the country offers diverse weather conditions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Hot and humid, particularly in the southern and coastal regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures and lower humidity, ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cool and dry in the north, mild and wet in the south.  Snowfall is common in the mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny, with blooming wildflowers and pleasant temperatures.

naturalWonders.name: Yucatan Peninsula
naturalWonders.description: The Yucatan Peninsula is a tropical region known for its stunning beaches, turquoise waters, and ancient Mayan ruins. It’s a captivating blend of natural beauty and historical significance.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This peninsula boasts the world-famous Mayan cities of Chichen Itza, Tulum, and Palenque, alongside cenotes (sinkholes) offering unique swimming experiences. The region’s diverse ecosystems range from rainforests to coral reefs.

naturalWonders.name: Copper Canyon
naturalWonders.description: Often called the 'Grand Canyon of Mexico,' the Copper Canyon is a series of interconnected canyons in the Sierra Madre Occidental mountains, larger and deeper than the Grand Canyon.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This vast canyon system offers breathtaking views, opportunities for hiking, horseback riding, and exploring indigenous villages. The region is rich in biodiversity and offers a unique cultural experience.

naturalWonders.name: Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Sian Ka'an is a vast protected area encompassing mangrove forests, lagoons, and coral reefs, teeming with wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This biosphere reserve is a crucial habitat for numerous species, including jaguars, sea turtles, and hundreds of bird species. It offers opportunities for eco-tourism, kayaking, and wildlife viewing.

ecosystemData.title: Mexico's Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Mexico’s geography supports a remarkable array of ecosystems, from arid deserts to lush rainforests and extensive coral reefs. These ecosystems are vital for biodiversity and provide essential resources for the country’s economy and people.

biodiversityCategories.description: Mexico is home to a diverse range of mammals, including jaguars, ocelots, bears, and numerous species of bats.

statistics.details: Found primarily in the southern regions

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Mexico is a birdwatcher’s paradise, boasting over 1,000 bird species, including numerous migratory birds.

biodiversityCategories.description: Mexico’s warm climate and diverse habitats support a rich diversity of reptiles and amphibians.
